channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meir Statman: Your State of Mind Influences Your Investing Success
item.description: Meir Statman shares his insights on the broader aspects of financial well-being and its interconnection with life satisfaction.

item.title: How to write an MBA resume that’ll help you get into business school
item.description: MBA resumes are similar to traditional job resumes, with a couple of key differences. Experts detail how to write one, what to avoid—and why.

item.title: Book Review: Trailblazers, Heroes, and Crooks
item.description: Stephen Foerster, CFA, extracts lessons from exceptional episodes in financial history that ordinary investors and seasoned professionals alike can put to profitable use. The bonus is that you'll be entertained from start to finish.

item.title: Biden backs off long-awaited ban on menthol cigarettes
item.description: “This decision prioritizes politics over lives, especially Black lives,” said Yolonda Richardson of the Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids, in an emailed statement.

item.title: What Price Risk? Unpacking the Equity Risk Premium
item.description: Stocks are a good wager over the long term, on favorable odds. But stocks remain a bet, and investors must grasp how much returns can vary over long time horizons.

item.title: Business travel survives the Zoom era, as leaders jump back on flights
item.description: Even with Zoom’s implementation, employee travel bounds back to pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Equity Income Investing Redux
item.description: No doubt the past year has been difficult for equity income investors. But history, inherent biases, mean reversion, and the current market backdrop point to a comeback.

item.title: Millennials have it better than everyone thinks, accumulating wealth faster than anyone else since the pandemic, new data shows
item.description: “This historic growth is without parallel in recent decades,” according to an analysis from the Center for American Progress.

item.title: Book Review: Enrich Your Future
item.description: This engaging book is simultaneously memorable and humorous. The numerous sports analogies will have you smiling as you absorb Larry Swedroe's unforgettable investment precepts.

item.title: MedMen’s spectacular collapse is complete: Just five years after earning a whopping $3 billion valuation, the one-time legal cannabis darling has declared bankruptcy
item.description: “MedMen has been ‘DeadMen’ to most investors for a long time,” one industry analyst told Fortune.
